thread.title: People are upset over this 'inappropriate' photo of Ivanka Trump sitting at her father's desk
thread.title_full: People are upset over this 'inappropriate' photo of Ivanka Trump sitting at her father's desk

author: Nicola Oakley
title: People are upset over this 'inappropriate' photo of Ivanka Trump sitting at her father's desk
text:
People are upset over this 'inappropriate' photo of Ivanka Trump sitting at her father's desk The picture of Donald Trump's daughter was labelled 'amazingly inappropriate' and 'absolutely disgusting' Share Donald Trump's daughter Ivanka smiles in between her father and Canadian PM Justin Trudeau (Photo: Ivanka Trump/Twitter) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing!   
Donald Trump has officially been President of the United States for almost one whole month - and that month has not been without its controversy. 
Every day there seems to be a new reason for Americans who did not want him in the country's most powerful seat to be angry with him and his team. 
And his family isn't immune from this, either. 
Yesterday, his daughter Ivanka took to Twitter to share a photograph of herself with her father and Canadian Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, following the two leaders' meeting and press conference. 
But many people took offence to where she was sitting in the snap - at her father's desk in the Oval Office. Ivanka shared the image on Twitter (Photo: Ivanka Trump/Twitter) 
She captioned the photo: "A great discussion with two world leaders about the importance of women having a seat at the table!" along with emojis of the US and Canadian flags. 
It was undoubtedly meant to look like a positive tweet supporting women, but outraged social media users immediately began telling her she had no right to sit at that desk. 
They claimed that, given the fact there has never been a female President, no woman has ever been elected to sit at that desk - and the first woman who does should have rightfully earned it. 
Many pointed out she hadn't earned the seat of the table, and was only there because she has a rich father, and wondered what the reaction would be if Obama had shared similar images of one of his daughters sitting at the desk. 
Others called her presence at the meeting "unethical", considering she doesn't hold a place in the government at all. 
But there were some who rushed to her defence, excusing it as 'nothing more than a photo opportunity'. 
Ivanka has been labelled a 'substitute FLOTUS' - First Lady of the United States - given her prominence during her father's campaign and now he is in the White House. 
In contrast, Trump's wife Melania, the real FLOTUS, is not moving to Washington DC and will be staying at the couple's property in New York City. Read More Is this why Melania's face dropped at Donald Trump's inauguration? Viewers think they've spotted cause 
On Inauguration Day, when Melania's face famously dropped from a smile to a frown after her husband turned to talk to her, some suggested the real reason was because Trump had actually turned to talk to Ivanka, and looked right through his wife.
